entry.title: How I got there
entry.content:
The path disappears again,
Faces blurring into one another,
Gasping for air, I look down,
The depth of the fall is horrific,
Maybe I am wrong to keep going,
Maybe someone else spoke my words,
I am all I need though,
No man to save the day,
But he just might, at the right time and place,
Breathing life onto a journey still in the making,
Just enough to keep me going for a bit longer,
And then dropping me down this cliff,
into a void so I can find myself all over again.
Let it go, let it be,
those words of wisdom,
fail to comfort me,
I know it's going to be okay,
After darkness comes another day,
and with it comes a possibility, just a possibility
that I'll make it, out of this tunnel and into the light
but this time, know exactly how I got there.

entry.title: Before the dawn breaks
entry.content:
Ready for the last mile,
Rising before the dawn breaks,
Putting one foot in front of another,
A light guiding our way,
Feeling the pain of the past,
And all that went wrong,
Hand in hand in hand in hand,
We march on strong,
The gates will open wide,
Our path will appear,
The sun will shine so bright,
The moon will disappear,
As we reach the summit,
The clouds bow down,
Purple velvet turns crimson,
And the future joins us,
Out of air and out of breath,
Take a moment to see,
That we are the love we seek,
And that we were always here.

entry.title: Breaking waves
entry.summary: I once tried to learn how to surf, and...
entry.content:
Sun shining on the blue seas,
Inviting me in despite my fears,
The warm air beats cold waters,
A summer of hope is here.

Waves crashing, churning, drowning,
Sending me back, many strokes,
Giving in, diving, tumbling, paddling,
I try again, to get past the breaking waves.

Maybe I am not strong enough,
To get to where I can start to surf,
To fail in all the right ways,
And finally, get a chance to learn.

Stop trying, it's time to give up,
Let the ocean carry me to shores,
Feel the warmth instead, lying in the sun,
Mastering the art of letting go.
